instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> Shorted (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message:
Hello,

All coils are good except <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3_REG</SIGNAL>

I confirmed a short circuit on <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL>
I inject 1V and nothing is heating up. I don't want to inject more to avoid further damage.

Do you think of a possible RAM problem, if so I start with which one?

thank you in advance

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> Shorted (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message:
You can inject until 1.5V.
Which is the exact ohm value (not diode mode) of the short?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> Shorted (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message:
I mesure 0,0 Ohm

1V5 still nothing is heating ...

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> Shorted (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message:
Impossible to get exactly 0.0 ohm; multimeter probes should give 0.3 ohm aprox.

Pure short may block a 5A lab PSU to inject; set amp linit to max before.
You may need 20A PSU...

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> Shorted (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message:
Indeed I have 0.2 Ohm when I stay on it.

How much voltage do you want me to inject ?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> Shorted (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message:
I said UNTIL 1.5V; doesn't mean to inject 1.5V directly.
Start injecting with 0.8V and go high if needed.
5A PSU may not help you at all...
